message:
{
    "name": "Janis-Newman-Winicour metric in the context of a rotating, charged, and massive black hole",
    "abbrev": "janisnewmanwinicour",
    "description": "The Janis-Newman-Winicour metric describes the spacetime surrounding a rotating, charged, and massive black hole. This metric plays a crucial role in understanding the effects of rotation, charge, and mass on the curvature of spacetime.",
    "defined": true,
    "derived": true,
    "signature": -1,
    "dimensions": 4,

    "charts": [
        {
            "chartName": "Boyer-Lindquist",
            "xlineElement": "(-dt^2 + (1 - 2*m/r - q^2/r^3)*(dx^2 + dy^2 + dz^2) + (1 - 2*m/r)*(r^2*dt^2) + 2*m*r*(1 - 2*m/r - q^2/r^3)*dt*dz + q^2*r^2*(1 - 2*m/r - q^2/r^3)*dz^2) / ( (1 - 2*m/r - q^2/r^3)*(1 - 2*m/r) - (m*r*(1 - 2*m/r - q^2/r^3))^2/r^2 )",
            "validated": false,
        }
    ],
    "desiredProperties": ["christoffels", "ricci", "riemann", "einstein", "weyl", "g00", "infiniteRedShift", "horizons", "singularities", "limits"],
    "diagrams": []
}[0m
